chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (You are a psychologist.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (After graduation, you were invited by your father——)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (the dean of Mindscape Chamber, to work there.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (Today is your first day on the job.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: [Hint: Press W / D to move]

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (Today is a new day.)

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (You arrived early today again, so there is almost no one in the clinic.)

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: (I should really talk to my father. There's clearly something wrong with this ‘experiment’)

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: (Ever since treating Ms. Emma, I’ve been hearing things occasionally...)

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: (And having strange nightmares...)

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: (In the dreams, dad and mom argue again, but then the scene shifts—mother lies in a pool of blood...)

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: (Am I just too tired?)

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: (Maybe I should see a therapist too.)

chapter_3.speaker: narrator
chapter_3.text: ???: [That wasn’t a nightmare.]

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: What do you mean?

chapter_3.speaker: narrator
chapter_3.text: ???: [I mean it literally. You still haven’t remembered anything? Not even a little?]

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: What are you talking about?

chapter_3.speaker: narrator
chapter_3.text: ???: [He killed Mother.]

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: Don’t joke about that.

chapter_3.speaker: narrator
chapter_3.text: ???: [I know you won’t believe it. After all, you’ve forgotten everything—me included.]

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: Hello! Are you the new psychologist?

not_a_doctor.speaker: npc
not_a_doctor.text: Eh~ I thought such a handsome guy would be our new doctor!

not_a_doctor.speaker: npc
not_a_doctor.text: Are you here to see the Dean? He just left for a meeting.

not_a_doctor.speaker: player
not_a_doctor.text: .....Sorry, I was joking. Seems like my sense of humor needs work.

not_a_doctor.speaker: narrator
not_a_doctor.text: (You see her pause, and then chuckle.)

not_a_doctor.speaker: npc
not_a_doctor.text: Ha Ha, you are quite an interesting person.

a_doctor.speaker: npc
a_doctor.text: The Dean mentioned that we had a new psychologist starting today, but I didn't expect him to be so handsome!

a_doctor.speaker: narrator
a_doctor.text: (Her compliment makes your ears turn red.)

chapter_1_common.speaker: npc
chapter_1_common.text: I'm Nuva, the receptionist nurse. If you have any questions, feel free to ask me—your senior!

chapter_1_common.speaker: npc
chapter_1_common.text: Oh, by the way, already have a patient booked a session with you for today.

chapter_1_common.speaker: npc
chapter_1_common.text: She is waiting in your office, you can head over when you are ready

repeat_only.speaker: npc
repeat_only.text: She is waiting in your office, you can head over when you are ready

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Good morning! You're very early today!

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Yes. Good morning.

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (Ms. Zheng and Father's relation... I'm still concerned about it.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (Just what is the 'experiment' all about?)

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Of course~ He's in his office right now.

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Are you looking for him?

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Yes. There's something I need to discuss with him. Where is his office?

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: It's right next to yours~

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (So the locked room was actually his office...)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: I see. Thank you. I'll take my leave then.

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Alright~ Bye bye~!

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Dean's office is next to yours~

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: Morning~

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: (This nurse seems to be full of energy every day)

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: Good morning.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: You look tired. Did you have trouble sleeping?

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: Something like that.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: I can get you a coffee if you'd like!

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: I'd appreciate that, thank you.

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: (... Let's go find Father.)

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: (So this is the clinic......)

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: It is 8:10 a.m. You're 50 minutes early.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: I just wanted to familiarize myself with the environment...Father.

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (When you called him 'Father' you notice his brow furrow slightly.)

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: In the clinic, we are considered superior and subordinate. Try not to call me ‘Father’ here.

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: I should go now, I have a meeting to attend. Feel free to look around your own.

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (He exits the clinic.)

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: (Before exploring, I should send a message to mom.)

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: (You take out your phone and open the chat with your mother.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (However,the chat is filled with your own messages.She doesn't read or reply to them.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (You have had been in the habit of updating her ever since your father said she left home.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (From what you ate for lunch, to the friends you've made or your choice of major—every little story is in this chat.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (What you truly hope for, is her response, and maybe an explanation, nothing more.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (You type in the chat box)

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Today is my first day at work.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Finally, I've become a doctor, like Father.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Would you be proud of me, Mom?

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (You stare at the unanswered chat for a few seconds then put your phone back to pocket.)

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Maybe I should walk around clinic first.

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Is there a problem?

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: There's something I need to discuss with you.

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (Should I play it by ear, or just get straight to the point?)

choice.option: Did you used to have a student by the name of JiaLu Zheng?
Have you ever been involved in experiments before?

student.speaker: player
student.text: Did you used to have a student by the name of JiaLu Zheng?

student.speaker: narrator
student.text: (You see him thinking for a moment.)

student.speaker: npc
student.text: I do. She was one of my best students.

student.speaker: npc
student.text: She had worked under me once. It was a pity she didn't pursue psychology further after her degree

student.speaker: npc
student.text: She came here for a consultation some time ago, and in her subconscious, I saw you appearing in her memories

student.speaker: npc
student.text: That is the patient's private matter. Do not simply bring this up on your own accord.......

experiment.speaker: player
experiment.text: Have you ever been involved in experiments before?

experiment.speaker: player
experiment.text: (You notice his eyes turn sharp at the word 'experiments'. The room was warm but you felt a chill in your bones.)

experiment.speaker: npc
experiment.text: (It's gone the next moment, as if it was merely an illusion.)

experiment.speaker: npc
experiment.text: As a researcher, participating in academic research-related experiments is a part of my job. Which one are you referring to?

experiment.speaker: player
experiment.text: A psychology-related experiment? One that also involved Ms. Zheng.

experiment.speaker: narrator
experiment.text: (You noticed the look of understanding crossing his expression. ... But what exactly did he understand?)

experiment.speaker: npc
experiment.text: Ah, I see now. Ms. Zheng was the intern under me. She helped with routine data collection for the experiment.

experiment.speaker: player
experiment.text: There seems to be some cases of 'failure' though? What went on in the experiment, and what happened to the patients?

experiment.speaker: narrator
experiment.text: (He puts a hand up to interrupt you, revealing a watch under his sleeve, one that your mother gave him.)

experiment.speaker: npc
experiment.text: In our practice, we call that 'underperformed'.

experiment.speaker: npc
experiment.text: You should focus more on treating the patient, not talking about their private matters like you've uncovered some conspiracy.

experiment.speaker: npc
experiment.text: If there's nothing else, do see yourself out.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: ...So you've come.

chapter_3.speaker: narrator
chapter_3.text: (He does not look surprised at your sudden appearance.)

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: This is where the 'experiment' happens...? You wouldn’t be careless, so is you let me find this place?

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: Correct. You already know too much.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: So, what is your conclusion?

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: ...Your hypnosis therapy—it's a pyramid built on the trauma of others.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: Thats call 'underperformed'.

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: But their pain is real!

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: Miss Emma was one of them… She said she didn’t know why the nightmares kept happening more and more.

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: That was from a failed session, wasn’t it?

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: I don’t deny that. But not all cases fail.

chapter_3.speaker: player
chapter_3.text: ...You mean Ms. Zheng? I don’t understand how she accepted it.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: She couldn’t handle the truth. When she saw the failed cases in the reports, she began to doubt herself.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: So I had to hypnotize her to make her forget everything.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: Fortunately, it went very well.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: Science exploration always comes at a price. Whether they failed or succeeded... they contributed to the advancement of psychology.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: It's like the trolley problem.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: Five people tied to the track versus pulling the lever to change train direction and sacrifice one.

chapter_3.speaker: npc
chapter_3.text: What would you choose?

chapter_3.speaker: narrator
chapter_3.text: (This choice affects the ending.)

choice.option: Pull the lever and sacrifice one
Don't give me that philosophical nonsense

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: player
Ship_of_Theseus.text: ...If I must choose, I’ll pull the lever

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (He smiles, pleased.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: npc
Ship_of_Theseus.text: Good. You understand.

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: npc
Ship_of_Theseus.text: Science requires trade-offs. My research will save more in the end.

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: npc
Ship_of_Theseus.text: Now, will you join me? Together, we can perfect this therapy.

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (A few months later.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (The clinic’s lights remain bright.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (By day, you treat patients with the machine. By night, you refine the 'therapy' in the basement.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (At first, you hesitated. Paused at failed reports.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (Now, you calmly record data, analyze errors, and adjust the next experiment’s parameters.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: player
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (No sacrifice, no salvation.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: player
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (I must keep going.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (One year later—a research conference.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (Spotlights flash. You stand at the podium before a dark sea of faces.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: player
Ship_of_Theseus.text: Our research proves that the human brain is not an immutable hard drive.

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: player
Ship_of_Theseus.text: With precise hypnosis, we can strip away trauma and rebuild a healthy psyche.

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (Applause erupts.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (You continue your speech and return to your father’s side after)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (He hands you a glass of champagne. Reflected on the surface are your two faces—same white coat, same calm gaze.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (He raises his glass.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: (Glasses clink, crisp and icy.)

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: player
Ship_of_Theseus.text: To the future.

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: ???: You gradually inherited his will, like a ship with its planks replaced one by one.

Ship_of_Theseus.speaker: narrator
Ship_of_Theseus.text: ???: Do you still think you're the same person you once were?

Justice_Served.speaker: player
Justice_Served.text: I won’t pull the lever... Every life deserves an equal chance.

Justice_Served.speaker: npc
Justice_Served.text: Naïve. Still clinging to morals

Justice_Served.speaker: player
Justice_Served.text: ...I can’t accept your ideals, Father.

Justice_Served.speaker: player
Justice_Served.text: And I won’t let this continue.

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (A few weeks later.)

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (You sit on the couch, staring blankly at the newspaper.......

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: the headline reads: “Famed Psychologist Under Investigation for Illegal Human Experimentation”.)

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (The image shows your father being escorted away by police—his lab coat neat, expression detached.)

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (You chose justice that night in the basement—you called the police)

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (The TV reports: “The clinic has been shut down. Authorities uncovered large volumes of unauthorized hypnosis records...”)

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (You turn off the TV. The room is eerily silent except for the ticking clock.)

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (Flashback—the night you called the police.)

Justice_Served.speaker: npc
Justice_Served.text: Do you really want to do this?

Justice_Served.speaker: player
Justice_Served.text: Your 'patients' had families too.

Justice_Served.speaker: npc
Justice_Served.text: Science needs sacrifice.

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (He says it like stating a fact)

Justice_Served.speaker: player
Justice_Served.text: …No.

Justice_Served.speaker: player
Justice_Served.text: Science requires ethics, not blood.

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (His expression cracks—not rage, but a cold, almost disappointed indifference.)

Justice_Served.speaker: npc
Justice_Served.text: What a pity.

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (You press the call button.)

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (Now, in court.)

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (The gavel falls.)

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: Judge:Defendant, do you have anything to say?

Justice_Served.speaker: narrator
Justice_Served.text: (Your father stands in the defendant’s box. His gaze sweeps across the courtroom and lands on you.)

Justice_Served.speaker: npc
Justice_Served.text: My only regret is failing to teach my son...

Justice_Served.speaker: npc
Justice_Served.text: That science has no room for mercy.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Don't give me that philosophical nonsense. Stop trying to justify yourself!

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: npc
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Too emotional. Like your mother.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Don’t bring her up now. If you hadn’t fought her so much, she wouldn’t have left home—

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: I even hear voices in my head saying you killed her—what a joke...

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (You see his face twist: shock, shameful anger, and a trace of sorrow.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Is it true?

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (His silence is a blade, slicing through years of lies.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (A sound—glass shattering. Not in the room, but your mind.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ('Crack')

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (Memory floods in.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (Flashback)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (An empty classroom. Equations still faintly on the blackboard)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [Ugh. Rain again.]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Rain's peaceful.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [Not for me. Reminds me of their shouting this morning.]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Forget that. I’m here. Let’s go.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (He slowly packs up, grabs an umbrella, and walks out.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [Don’t wanna go home...]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: There’s cake in the fridge. That might cheer you up.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [I guess.]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (He agrees, but doesn’t speed up.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???:  [Sometimes I wish I could give you control of my body. You’re stronger.]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: I’m here to protect you.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [Protected by my own alter...Pathetic.]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (They arrive at home.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: It’s not pathetic. That’s why you created me.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (He opens the door.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (Blood—deep red blood—spreads to feet.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (In the center lies the woman who had always gently stroked his hair)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [M...Mother?]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (Her pupils are dilated, eyes still toward the door—as if even in death, she was worried her child would see this.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (At the top of the stairs stands Father. His lab coat hem drips with dark red.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: DON’T LOOK!!!

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (Too late. He retreats, leaving you in control—just as pain explodes in your skull.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (You’re knocked out cold.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (When you wake, a cold glint of a pocket watch is in your face.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: npc
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: From today on, your mother just left home.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: npc
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: You fainted from grief.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: npc
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Tomorrow, everything will be fine.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (Back to the present.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ...You bastard.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: npc
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: You think I wanted this? She found the data—threatened to ruin my life’s work——

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (You grab his collar, cutting him off.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: I should kill you for her.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [Don’t dirty your hands. Call the police.]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [You still have a future.]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (You breathe deeply and let go.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Save your excuses for the police.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (He says nothing more. He closes his eyes, like a criminal awaiting judgment.)

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: (after a few weeks...

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [Are you alright?]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Shouldn’t I be asking you? You’re the original personality.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [Because I accepted the truth long ago. You haven’t.]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [Do you think Father will regret it? In prison?]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: Maybe. Maybe not. I just wanted him punished.

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: player
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ...By the way, don't you want to take body control again?

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [ No. This is fine.]

Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.speaker: narrator
Rebirth_of_the_Dual_Soul.text: ???: [ This time, let me protect you.]

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Sorry for the wait. I’m your scheduled psychologist. You’re Ms. Zheng, right?

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (You see she sitting upright and nod.)

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: Yes, hello.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Alright, Ms. Zheng. First, we will start with getting to know you and understanding your situation.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Feel free to talk about whatever has brought you here—there’s no need to hold back. Where would you like to start?

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (She sighs, a mixture of resignation and relief.)

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: ......I've always felt like I have to do everything perfectly.

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: So at work, I strive for perfection, but instead of improving outcomes, it just.....slows me down.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: You think your perfection has impacted your efficiency? Can you describe a recent example?

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: Last week, while working on a proposal, I spent nearly four hours tweaking minor details.

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: It was already finished, but I kept trying to make it more polished and professional

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: I ended up staying up until early morning, which affected my performance at the meeting the next day.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Hmm. During that process, how do you feel? Was there any concerning reaction?

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: ......When during that time, my heart was racing, and my hands trembled uncontrollably. I felt an overwhelming tension.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Did any specific thoughts cross your mind? Like, 'If I don’t make this perfect, then…'?

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (She closes her eyes, brows slightly furrowed, as if resisting an admission. But after a pause, she nods.)

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: ...…Yes. I thought, “If this proposal isn’t perfect and something goes wrong, it could stain my entire career.”

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: Just thinking about that will made me feel awful

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: (Perfectionism-induced anxiety. CBT (Cognitive Behavioral Therapy) might be an appropriate and effective approach here.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is a form of psychological treatment

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: that has been demonstrated to be effective for a range of problems

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: including depression, anxiety disorders, alcohol and drug use problems, marital problems, eating disorders, and severe mental illness. )

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (CBT treatment usually involves efforts to change thinking patterns. )

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: I heard that this clinic have some kind of machine here which can treat psychological problems. Can that fix mine directly?

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: (Wait a minute—this isn’t where I expected the session to go. But…...I did forget about machine.)

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Yes, that 'helmet' on my desk is the machine. It can access to a person's subconscious and view past memories.

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: All memories?

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: No, only those relevant to your anxiety.

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: How does viewing memories relate to treatment?

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: (Her tone makes me feel like I’m being interrogated by a superior......)

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: The memories help identify the root cause. The actual treatment involves 'activities' within the subconscious.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: It’s a process of memory restructuring. By preserving or destroying emotional anchors, we can rapidly relieve symptoms.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: But also there is a chance of failure

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: It’s not a conventional therapy method. Are you sure about this approach? I believe a gentler method might be more suitable.....

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: No, I choose this one. I need a quick way to completely solve the problem.

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: I understand your desire to recover quickly. But please read this consent form carefully before making a final decision

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (You hand her the consent form about machine.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (She takes it, adjusts her glasses, and reads it intently.)

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (After a moment, she looks up.)

chapter_1.speaker: npc
chapter_1.text: I’ve read it. I’m willing to accept the risks. Just need to sign here, right?

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: Right. Once you sign, I’ll prepare the treatment.

chapter_1.speaker: narrator
chapter_1.text: (She signs without hesitation and returns the form to you.)

chapter_1.speaker: player
chapter_1.text: (Alright, let’s begin.)

chapter_1_common.speaker: player
chapter_1_common.text: (I’ve finished speaking with the patient. Time to begin treatment using the machine.)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (This memory is blurry—snatches of conversations and report writing. Words on the reports catch your eye.)

after_puzzle.speaker: player
after_puzzle.text: (Hypnotherapy Results......? Is this the “experiment”?)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (You read the report—overwhelming with technical terms.)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (Reports pile up, dense with jargon. The first, the second, the third... All share one conclusion)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (Failure)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (A sense of unease—and inexplicable familiarity—washes over you.)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (As the memory fades, you find something in your hand)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (A notebook. But no tidy lines, no neat notes, no highlights—just blank pages.)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (Perhaps emptiness, too, is a form of perfection.)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (But who defines perfection? Who enforces it?)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: You’re no philosopher. No need to dwell on that.

after_puzzle.speaker: player
after_puzzle.text: (This is Ms. Zheng’s emotional anchor......)

after_puzzle.speaker: player
after_puzzle.text: (Destroy it, and her symptoms vanish—but so do parts of her memory. Keep it, and the cure may be incomplete. What should I choose?)

back_reality_destroy1.speaker: narrator
back_reality_destroy1.text: (You remove the device from her head.)

back_reality_destroy1.speaker: player
back_reality_destroy1.text: Treatment is complete. How do you feel? Any discomfort?

back_reality_destroy1.speaker: player
back_reality_destroy1.text: Great. Based on your subconscious, I made a treatment decision. You will recover soon.

back_reality_destroy1.speaker: player
back_reality_destroy1.text: But please remember—don’t push yourself too hard. You’ve done very well, whether as a top student, an employee, or simply as yourself

sub_end_1.speaker: npc
sub_end_1.text: (That doctor’s treatment really worked. I don’t get anxious over little things anymore.)

sub_end_1.speaker: npc
sub_end_1.text: (My boss even said I seem refreshed. Efficiency has improved.)

sub_end_1.speaker: npc
sub_end_1.text: (This stable routine is all I need...)

sub_end_1.speaker: narrator
sub_end_1.text: ?: Zheng! Are you coming to the celebration party tonight? Boss is treating us for the successful proposal!

back_reality_keep1.speaker: narrator
back_reality_keep1.text: (You remove the device from her head.)

back_reality_keep1.speaker: player
back_reality_keep1.text: Treatment is complete. How do you feel? Any discomfort?

back_reality_keep1.speaker: player
back_reality_keep1.text: Great. Based on your subconscious, I made a treatment decision. You will recover soon.

back_reality_keep1.speaker: player
back_reality_keep1.text: But please remember—don’t push yourself too hard. You’ve done very well, whether as a top student, an employee, or simply as yourself

sub_end_2.speaker: npc
sub_end_2.text: (That doctor’s treatment really worked. I don’t get anxious over small things anymore.)

sub_end_2.speaker: npc
sub_end_2.text: (More importantly, I remembered what I truly wanted.)

sub_end_2.speaker: npc
sub_end_2.text: (How could I have forgotten? My dream of studying psychology deeply (professionally?))

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Good morning, are you Ms. Emma?

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (She nodded politely.)

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: I am. Good morning to you too.

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (Her voice is soft and delicate on the ears.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (A very gentle voice...)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Okay then, Ms. Emma, is there something you'd like to talk to me about? Anything at all.

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Well, you see, some time ago, I had been caught in a... a car accident.

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (She lowered her head, but quickly picked it back up, giving you a faint smile.)

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Fortunately, I was not seriously injured and recovery was smooth.

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: However, ever since, I've been having nightmares of the car accident. To the point it affects my sleep.

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: At first, the nightmares happened occasionally, maybe twice a week, But for some reason, it's becoming more frequently lately.

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (You noticed the dark rings under her eyes. It's clear she hasn't had a good night's sleep in a long time.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Thank you for telling me this. Has there been anything else, besides the nightmares?

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Does being afraid of driving count? Even if I wasn't the one driving, I find that I have trouble breathing and my hands shake uncontrollably.

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Even the driver that sent me here worried about how pale I looked.

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (When she said this, her hand gripped her skirt.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: ... I see how uncomfortable you look. Do you feel pain anywhere?

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Um... Maybe my chest? It feels like there's a tight .pressure on it

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: If you'd like, we can do a simple breathing exercise to help with the tightness. Just follow my instructions... Inhale for 4 seconds... Hold for 2... Exhale for 6...

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (She repeated this three times.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Do you feel a bit better?

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Yes... The pressure has eased a bit.

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (Ms. Emma's case, seems to be trauma caused by a car accident.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (In that case, the best treatment would be TF-CBT (Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy))

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (But this treatment would be long-term, if she wants something quicker, the machine would be the better option.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: I believe I have a basic understanding of your situation, and I have two options for you.

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: You could try TF-CBT, a type of behavioral therapy that will focus on how to deal with your trauma. It is the safest and most reliable method, but you will be in for the long run.

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: The other option would be to use the clinic's machine for treatment. There's a chance for failure, but otherwise, you should expect to see results very quickly.

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: Actually, it's because I've heard about this clinic's 'machine' that I decided to seek treatment here.

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (Am I the only one who forgot about the existence of the machine when I first came here?)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Alright, since you are considering, I should explain about how this treatment will go...

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (You repeated what you said to Miss Zheng to Emma)

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (She listens carefully and nods from time to time)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: ... and that should be all. Here is the contract, along with a more detailed description. Take your time to read it through.

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (You handed her the contract, and as she read it intently, you felt something flash through your mind.)

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: ???: [... The poor soul.]

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (This voice does not sound like yours or Emma's.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Who !?

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (But there is no one else, besides you and Emma.)

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (Emma continues to read the contract with little reaction. It seems you are the only one that heard the voice.)

chapter_2.speaker: npc
chapter_2.text: ... I'm done. I will go with the machine treatment.

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Very well then, please sign here...

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: ???: [... Don't- Don't use the machine.]

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (Seriously. Where am I hearing this from?)

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (You choose to ignore the voice for now.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: Here's a pen.

chapter_2.speaker: narrator
chapter_2.text: (After she signs, she hands the contract and pen back to you.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: (We can start now.)

chapter_2.speaker: player
chapter_2.text: I’ve finished speaking with the patient. Time to begin treatment using the machine.

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (She entered a clinic)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (You find the place familiar)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (Familiar notice board, familiar front desk, familiar structure...)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (It's a little old-fashioned, and the person at the front desk is not a nurse you know, but this is definitely the clinic.)

after_puzzle.speaker: player
after_puzzle.text: (She's already been here before?)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (She walked up to the counter.)

after_puzzle.speaker: npc
after_puzzle.text: Hello... I booked an appointment at 1?

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: nurse ? :Ah, right, head to the furthest door down this corridor. The doctor is waiting for you.

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (The scene shifts. You do not recognize this place.)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (It's dark and small, was your first thought. Like some sort of basement.)

after_puzzle.speaker: npc
after_puzzle.text: Doctor, will this really help me? I don't... I don't want to see that truck rushing towards me anymore, or feel like I'm suffocating, or... or-

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (She paused when the other person raised their hand.)

after_puzzle.speaker: npc
after_puzzle.text: Calm down, and try to focus on the now. See this pocket watch?

after_puzzle.speaker: player
after_puzzle.text: (Father...)

after_puzzle.speaker: npc
after_puzzle.text: Try and focus on its swinging... Yes, exactly like that.

after_puzzle.speaker: player
after_puzzle.text: (Is this related to that 'experiment' as well?)

after_puzzle.speaker: npc
after_puzzle.text: Imagine yourself standing in a long hallway... At the very end, there is a door, behind which is the memory you wish to forget.

after_puzzle.speaker: npc
after_puzzle.text: Now, put your hand on the doorknob, and slowly push it open.

after_puzzle.speaker: npc
after_puzzle.text: N-no! That- That truck is- It's coming towards me!

after_puzzle.speaker: npc
after_puzzle.text: You are resisting too much. Hypnosis requires cooperation, not resistance.

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (As he said this, he wrote something on a piece of paper and put it aside.)

after_puzzle.speaker: npc
after_puzzle.text: That's all for today. Remember to take your medicine on time.

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (Emma nodded, not looking at the paper. But you could read it, very very clearly)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (It was an assessment of sorts. But what was written in the conclusion made your breath stutter.)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: ?:  [... He was exactly like this to you. Do you still not remember?]

after_puzzle.speaker: player
after_puzzle.text: (There's that voice again...)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (As the memory fades, you find something in your hand)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (It was a set of car keys.)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (A convenient means of transportation in modern society, and the source of someone's nightmare.)

after_puzzle.speaker: narrator
after_puzzle.text: (You already know the process. Time to choose.)

back_reality_destroy2.speaker: narrator
back_reality_destroy2.text: (You take the device off of her head)

back_reality_destroy2.speaker: player
back_reality_destroy2.text: The treatment is done, how do you feel? Do you feel uncomfortable?

back_reality_destroy2.speaker: player
back_reality_destroy2.text: That's good. I had made a treatment decision, so you should not have a problem with the nightmares anymore.

back_reality_destroy2.speaker: npc
back_reality_destroy2.text: Alright. Thank you very much, doctor.

sub_end_3.speaker: npc
sub_end_3.text: (The nightmares are really gone... and I am no longer afraid of getting into a car.)

sub_end_3.speaker: npc
sub_end_3.text: (It's great! I feel relieved, and I can work again)

sub_end_3.speaker: npc
sub_end_3.text: (But... Why do I feel like something's missing?)

sub_end_3.speaker: npc
sub_end_3.text: (The camera flashes that once made my heart race are now nothing more then just blinding lights)

sub_end_3.speaker: npc
sub_end_3.text: (Walking the catwalk has become... forced. Precise but empty. Almost mechanical.)

sub_end_3.speaker: npc
sub_end_3.text: (When I look back at old photos of previous shows, the girl in them smiled, so confident and dazzling, but now, I no longer remember how she felt at that time.)

sub_end_3.speaker: narrator
sub_end_3.text: ?: Emma, there's an upcoming press conference that you'll be attending.

sub_end_3.speaker: npc
sub_end_3.text: (It was worth it to no longer wake up screaming at night.)

back_reality_keep2.text: (You take the device off of her head)

back_reality_keep2.speaker: player
back_reality_keep2.text: The treatment is done, how do you feel? Do you feel uncomfortable?

back_reality_keep2.speaker: player
back_reality_keep2.text: That's good. I had made a treatment decision, so you should not have a problem with the nightmares anymore.

back_reality_keep2.speaker: npc

sub_end_4.speaker: npc
sub_end_4.text: (It was all very clear... but I was unexpectedly calm)

sub_end_4.speaker: npc
sub_end_4.text: (The treatment had really helped. I'm no longer as scared as before.)

sub_end_4.speaker: npc
sub_end_4.text: (... I should get ready for work soon)

sub_end_4.speaker: narrator
sub_end_4.text: (After a shower, a change of clothes, some breakfast, I walked up to my car.)

sub_end_4.speaker: narrator
sub_end_4.text: (It did not start even after I got in.)

sub_end_4.speaker: npc
sub_end_4.text: (... It's okay, take it easy. Just like the first time I walked the runway.)

sub_end_4.speaker: narrator
sub_end_4.text: (The car started up and drove out. The sunlight shone its comforting warmth on the steering wheel.)

sub_end_4.speaker: npc
sub_end_4.text: (But for today, I have overcome it.)
